intro: Hieracium schraderi var. maius, commonly known as the greater meadow hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, and its leaves are lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. The species is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats and is often found in open, sunny environments.
